task: Grasping a Bottle from the Refrigerator

key_actions.description: Open the refrigerator door to access the bottle.
Visually scan the contents of the refrigerator to find the bottle.
Move your hand to the bottleâ€™s location, preparing to grasp it.
Securely grasp the bottle with your fingers, using your palm to support it.
Apply upward force to lift the bottle from its position in the refrigerator.
After removing the bottle, close the refrigerator door to ensure it remains sealed.

sensory_inputs.description: Used to visually locate the bottle in the refrigerator and ensure a proper grip.
Used to feel the bottle's shape, temperature, and grip for secure handling.
Provides feedback from the hands and arms to adjust grip strength and lifting motion.
Senses the cool temperature of the bottle to adjust handling, especially when it has been in the refrigerator.
